{"title":"Off-Ramps and On-Ramps: Keeping Talented Women on the Road to Success","meta:description":"Stepping off the career fast track is easy. Whats hard is getting back on. Careers, companies, and economies suffer when highly skilled women cannot get back where they belong."}

{"og:type":"article","article:section":"Career planning","article:publisher":"https://www.facebook.com/HBR","article:modified_time":"2019-10-15T18:45:04Z","og:image":["https://hbr.org/resources/images/article_assets/2013/09/110-Sylvia_Hewlett.jpg","https://hbr.org/resources/images/article_assets/2014/08/110-Carolyn_Buck-Luce.jpg","https://hbr.org/resources/images/hbr_opengraph_940x490.png"],"article:published_time":"2005-03-01T05:00:00Z","og:url":"https://hbr.org/2005/03/off-ramps-and-on-ramps-keeping-talented-women-on-the-road-to-success","article:tag":"Workspaces","og:description":"Stepping off the career fast track is easy.
